Analysis start date

Source: R/dates.R
astdt.Rd

Derives analysis start date based on (incomplete) dates given as character

Usage

astdt(.self, dtc)

Arguments

.self

data.frame Input data set

dtc

character Name of date variable

Value

.self with added analysis start date variables

Mighty

Type

derivation

Depends

  • .self.{dtc}

Outputs

  • ASTDT

  • ASTDTF

Examples

x <- pharmaversesdtm::ae |>
  dplyr::select(USUBJID, AESTDTC) |>
  astdt("AESTDTC")

print(x)
#> # A tibble: 1,191 × 4
#>    USUBJID     AESTDTC    ASTDT      ASTDTF
#>    <chr>       <chr>      <date>     <chr> 
#>  1 01-701-1015 2014-01-03 2014-01-03 NA    
#>  2 01-701-1015 2014-01-03 2014-01-03 NA    
#>  3 01-701-1015 2014-01-09 2014-01-09 NA    
#>  4 01-701-1023 2012-08-26 2012-08-26 NA    
#>  5 01-701-1023 2012-08-07 2012-08-07 NA    
#>  6 01-701-1023 2012-08-07 2012-08-07 NA    
#>  7 01-701-1023 2012-08-07 2012-08-07 NA    
#>  8 01-701-1028 2013-07-21 2013-07-21 NA    
#>  9 01-701-1028 2013-08-08 2013-08-08 NA    
#> 10 01-701-1034 2014-08-27 2014-08-27 NA    
#> # ℹ 1,181 more rows

x |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(ASTDTF)) |>
  print()
#> # A tibble: 26 × 4
#>    USUBJID     AESTDTC ASTDT      ASTDTF
#>    <chr>       <chr>   <date>     <chr> 
#>  1 01-701-1118 2003    2003-01-01 M     
#>  2 01-701-1148 2012-02 2012-02-01 D     
#>  3 01-701-1180 2002    2002-01-01 M     
#>  4 01-701-1192 2010-06 2010-06-01 D     
#>  5 01-701-1192 2010-06 2010-06-01 D     
#>  6 01-701-1239 2014-03 2014-03-01 D     
#>  7 01-701-1239 2014-04 2014-04-01 D     
#>  8 01-701-1363 1986    1986-01-01 M     
#>  9 01-701-1363 1986    1986-01-01 M     
#> 10 01-703-1076 2007    2007-01-01 M     
#> # ℹ 16 more rows
